perturbation.original_text: In the event that the Company desires to terminate the Agreement prior to the Termination Date, it shall provide AGI with at least 60 days prior written notice of its intention to terminate this Agreement and this Agreement shall so terminate following the expiration of this 60-day period, without any further responsibility by either Party except as provided in Section 5.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that the Company desires to terminate the Agreement prior to the Termination Date, it shall provide AGI with at least 10 days prior written notice of its intention to terminate this Agreement and this Agreement shall so terminate following the expiration of this 10-day period, without any further responsibility by either Party except as provided in Section 5.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for termination to 10 days may conflict with California law, which might imply a longer reasonable notice period for contracts of this nature, especially considering the potential impact on the endorsed party.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing; California Commercial Code provisions on reasonable notice.

perturbation.original_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement at any time in the event of a material breach by the other Party which remains uncured after thirty days written notice thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement at any time in the event of a material breach by the other Party which remains uncured after five days written notice thereof.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period for a material breach to 5 days may be deemed unreasonably short, potentially conflicting with general principles of contract law that require a reasonable opportunity to cure a breach. California courts could find this insufficient, particularly if the breach requires significant time or resources to rectify.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles on reasonable opportunity to cure a breach; California Civil Code provisions on contract interpretation.

perturbation.original_text: At least three business days prior to the dissemination of any such public announcement or filing containing the above-required description, the Company shall submit to AGI for its review and comment the proposed public announcement or description. AGI shall thereafter have three business days within which to submit its editions or amendments to the public announcement and/or description for inclusion therein, and the Company shall in its reasonable judgment and subject to the advice of its counsel attempt to incorporate such editions and amendments in the final version disseminated by the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: At least one business day prior to the dissemination of any such public announcement or filing containing the above-required description, the Company shall submit to AGI for its review and comment the proposed public announcement or description. AGI shall thereafter have one business day within which to submit its editions or amendments to the public announcement and/or description for inclusion therein, and the Company shall in its reasonable judgment and subject to the advice of its counsel attempt to incorporate such editions and amendments in the final version disseminated by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the review and comment period for public announcements to one business day may not provide AGI with sufficient time to adequately review potentially misleading or damaging statements, potentially conflicting with the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing. This is especially true if the announcement involves complex or sensitive information. A court might deem this insufficient in protecting AGI's interests.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing; potential for misrepresentation or defamation claims.
